alert.note: Alert for Northeastern Crook; Western Crook; Wyoming Black Hills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued November 08 at 1:28PM MST until November 11 at 5:00AM MST by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...STRONG WINTER STORM WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO THURSDAY... .A strong winter storm will develop across the Northern Plains Wednesday night and continue on Thursday. The expected track of the storm has shifted further north, with the heaviest snow likely to fall across far northwest South Dakota closer to the North Dakota border. While less snow totals are now expected along the I-90 corridor, strong northwest winds will still create blowing and drifting snow impacts. Some freezing rain is also possible, especially across south central South Dakota. Stay tuned to later forecasts as the track of the storm could shift again. ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY EVENING THROUGH LATE THURSDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Snow of 2 to 5 inches possible, with locally higher amounts in the northern Black Hills. The precipitation could begin as light freezing rain on the prairies of western South Dakota before changing to all snow late Wednesday night. Winds could gust as high as 55 mph. * WHERE...Portions of northwestern, southwestern and the Black Hills of South Dakota and northeast and the Black Hills of Wyoming. * WHEN...From Wednesday evening through Thursday night. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Strong winds could cause extensive damage to trees and power lines.
info.instruction: A Winter Storm Watch means heavy snow, strong winds, freezing precipitation, and cold temperatures are possible. Monitor NOAA weather radio, local radio or television, or the Internet for updates on this potentially dangerous storm. Take time to prepare for severe winter conditions before the storm develops.

area.areaDesc: Northeastern Crook; Western Crook; Wyoming Black Hills
